RELEASE: Wagner Releases Statement on Coronavirus Stimulus Legislation

Read my full statement here ➡️

https://t.co/fL7UpmHo3K
Please join me in praying for the quick recovery of @POTUS, @FLOTUS, and all those across the country and here in Missouri who have contracted COVID-19.

As we have seen during this tragedy, infectious diseases can spread across borders and oceans with deadly speed. Improving nations’ abilities to address public health threats before they spin out of control is a matter of national security.
 
Watch here.

https://t.co/zLNkcwpG4j

This week I spoke on the House Floor in support of H.R. 2166, the bipartisan Global Health Security Act.
 
This important bill will greatly bolster the United States’ ability to prevent and respond to global health threats like the coronavirus pandemic.

I have been hearing from employers across the Second District of Missouri who desperately need Congress to do its job & pass coronavirus relief legislation so they can do their job and keep handing out paychecks to their hardworking employees. Watch here.  https://t.co/SqfDWgsT1i

During this week’s FSC hearing I questioned Treasury Sec Mnuchin & Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on how the government is addressing the pandemic & helping workers & employers across the nation. At a time when so many are struggling, we must put America’s families first.

The Paycheck Protection Program has helped over 45,000 Missouri businesses just like St. Louis-based Martha’s Hands, a home health care provider with over 200 employees.

I spoke on the House Floor to urge my colleagues to vote in favor of our latest coronavirus relief legislation, the Paycheck Protection Program and Health Care Enhancement Act.  This legislation is poised to be a lifeline for Missouri workers and small businesses...

I joined my colleagues in calling on President Trump to condition future funding of the World Health Organization on the resignation of Director-General Tedros in the hopes that future leadership of the WHO will be less trusting of the CCP & more critical of self-serving regimes.

I have been on calls with my fellow Foreign Affairs Committee Members, and as Vice Ranking Member of the Committee, I know how important it is that Congress swiftly addresses this mismanagement so future pandemics can be prevented and mitigated.

At crucial points during the outbreak, Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus delayed stronger action by the WHO that could have curtailed the spread of the disease, and said that health inspections and evacuations from Wuhan were unnecessary.

The WHO did not challenge the CCP’s misinformation, preventing an earlier, more effective worldwide response to this viral outbreak. In addition to the WHO, China must also be held accountable for these actions.

At the onset of this pandemic, the CCP engaged in a concerted coverup regarding the extent of the coronavirus spread and human-to-human transmission, including by arresting doctors who sought to expose the true threat the virus posed.
It is clear that fear of offending the Communist Party of China (CCP) contributed to the World Health Organization’s mismanagement of the initial COVID-19 response.
